definition: see 打抱不平[da3 bao4 bu4 ping2]
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
to come to the aid of sb suffering an injustice/to fight for justice/also written 抱打不平[bao4 da3 bu4 ping2]
to speak out for justice (idiom); to take a stand on a matter of principle
to be outraged by an injustice
to cry out against injustice/to protest unfairness
feel wronged
to complain of an injustice/to lament sb's misfortune
lit. to intervene when one sees an injustice (idiom)/fig. to rush to the rescue/to play the white knight
pinyin: lu4 jian4 bu4 ping2 , ba2 dao1 xiang1 zhu4

definition: to uphold justice/to be loyal (to one's friends)/to stick by
to be chivalrous
see 路見不平，拔刀相助|路见不平，拔刀相助[lu4 jian4 bu4 ping2 , ba2 dao1 xiang1 zhu4]
to root out the strong and support the weak (idiom); to rob the rich and give to the poor
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to hate evil as one hates an enemy (idiom)
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
to complain bitterly
evil tyrant
